titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Norbert M. Bikales was the head of the Europe Office of the National Science Foundation (NSF) from 1995 to 1998. Prior to assuming this position he was Director of the NSF Polymers Program for 19 years. He had previously been Professor of Chemistry and Director of Continuing Education in the Sciences at Rutgers University. He served as chairman of the American Chemical Society's Polymer Division in 1983. For over 15 years, he was a member of the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) Commission on Macromolecular Nomenclature, serving as the Commission Secretary from 1977 to 1987.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of Bikales's service with the American Chemical Society Division of Polymer Chemistry and IUPAC, particularly the Commission on Macromolecular Nomenclature. Materials include: American Chemical Society administrative records and correspondence from the period preceding, during, and following Bikales's chairmanship of the Division of Polymer Chemistry; minutes of meetings and other administrative documents of the IUPAC Commission on Macromolecular Nomenclature; and files relating to the preparation of reports of the Commission on Macromolecular Nomenclature. The collection also includes records of the Working Party on Recycling of Polymers, of which Bikales was chairman from 1993 to 1997.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
